newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Electronics dominate Singapore noon stock activty.
newsitem.headline: Electronics dominate Singapore noon stock activty.

text.p: Singapore stocks rallied along with Wall Street at midday on Wednesday, led by small-capitalised electronics stocks, dealers said.
"Interest in blue chips remains thin. There is more interest in small-cap electronics and stocks below Singapore $1," a dealer with a U.S. institution said.
On Wednesday, a surge in U.S. technology stocks on Wall Street pushed the Nasdaq up a record 38.52 points to an unofficial close of 1,580.63.
At 0430 GMT, the SES electronics index surged 2.96 points or 2.16 percent to 139.84, led mostly by multimedia Creative Technology, which rose S$1.30 to a three-year high at S$33.20.
The Straits Times Industrials Index was fairly flat, at 1,919.73, underpinned by a 10 cent rise in drink firm Fraser & Neave to S$9.85.
Market sentiment turned positive, with interest seen from retail, institutional and Hong Kong investors, dealers said.
Activity was boosted with Malaysia closed for a one-day public holiday and total turnover was a robust 109.80 million shares, with 232 gainers to 75 losers.
Drug firm Tianjin Zhongxin was active with over 12.4 million shares traded. It rose 10 cents to hit a new high of US$1.24.

Book retailer Popular Holdings rose S$0.035 to S$0.52 on over 6.8 million shares after it posted 36 percent gains in net profit for year ended April 1997 to S$7.86 million. -- Angela Tan, Singapore newsroom (65 8703083)
